CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth King, 2219 Rosewell Street, Ingram Palace, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1958, pg.2 with question: "Do people, whom you know, place more emphasis on social life than civic responsibilities?" answer reads: "Out where I live in Ingram Palace the people seem to be more civic minded and are doing things for the children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth King, wearing dark flecked button down coat with wide collar and lapels, and dark gloves, holding light colored Kaufmanns shopping bag, standing in front of Marsh Wheeling store
